meanings.definition: To walk with long, decisive steps in a specified direction.
meanings.sent1: She was striding confidently towards the finish line.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys striding through the park every morning.
meanings.sent3: The penguin was striding around the zoo, amusing the visitors.
meanings.sent4: The champion boxer was striding towards victory in the ring.
meanings.sent5: The giant robot was striding across the city, causing chaos.

meanings.definition: To move forward with a long step or stride.
meanings.sent1: The horse was striding gracefully across the field.
meanings.sent2: The astronaut was striding towards the spaceship for the mission.
meanings.sent3: The clown was striding comically on stilts at the circus.
meanings.sent4: The river was striding through the valley, shaping the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The wind was striding through the trees, rustling the leaves.
